lead_paragraph: As Kansas struggles to close a $400 million budget gap, even anti-tax Republicans are acknowledging that there is not much more to cut without significantly hurting popular programs, including education.

headline.print_headline: To Fill Budget Hole, Kansas G.O.P. Considers the Unthinkable: Raising Taxes
headline.main: To Fill Budget Hole, Kansas G.O.P. Considers the Unthinkable: Raising Taxes

snippet: As Kansas struggles to close a $400 million budget gap, even anti-tax Republicans are acknowledging that there is not much more to cut without significantly hurting popular programs, including education.
abstract: Republican-led Legislature in Kansas appears ready to yield to fact that there is no way to bridge $400 million budget deficit without raising taxes, notion that many state lawmakers have vehemently rejected until now; only questions remaining are which taxes to raise.
